source.interface:
<implements name="MatrixDecomposition" />
* Tridiagonal: [A] = [Q][D][Q]H * Any square symmetric (hermitian) matrix [A] can be factorized by * similarity transformations into the form, * [A]=[Q][D][Q]-1 * where [Q] is an orthogonal (unitary) matrix and [D] is a real * symmetric tridiagonal matrix. Note that [D] can/should be made real * even when [A] has complex elements. Since [Q] is orthogonal (unitary) * [Q]-1 = [Q]H and when it is real [Q]H = [Q]T. apete
<method name="getD" type="MatrixStore" startLine="40" endLine="40" /> <method name="getQ" type="MatrixStore" startLine="42" endLine="42" />
